fruits.name: Apple
fruits.health_benefits: Apples are a good source of fiber and antioxidants. They may help improve heart health, aid in digestion, and support immune function.
fruits.side_effects: Some people may experience bloating or gas due to the fiber content. Apple seeds contain cyanide compounds, but you would need to consume a large amount of seeds to be affected.

fruits.name: Apricot
fruits.health_benefits: Apricots are rich in vitamin A, which is essential for vision health, as well as vitamin C, an antioxidant that supports the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Eating large amounts of apricots may cause gastrointestinal issues like diarrhea due to their high fiber content. The pits contain amygdalin, a compound that can release cyanide, so avoid consuming large quantities of them.

fruits.name: Banana
fruits.health_benefits: Bananas are a good source of potassium and vitamin B6, which are important for heart health and brain function. They also provide vitamin C for immune support.
fruits.side_effects: Eating too many bananas in a short period may lead to an excess intake of potassium, which can cause hyperkalemia, a condition that affects the heart rhythm.

fruits.name: Blueberry
fruits.health_benefits: Blueberries are packed with antioxidants and vitamin C, which can help combat oxidative stress and support the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Blueberries are generally safe to eat in moderation. However, some people may experience allergic reactions, and excessive consumption may cause stomach discomfort.

fruits.name: Cherry
fruits.health_benefits: Cherries are rich in antioxidants and vitamin C, which may help reduce inflammation and support skin health.
fruits.side_effects: Cherry pits contain cyanide compounds, but you would need to consume a large amount of pits to be affected. Some people may also experience allergic reactions to cherries.

fruits.name: Cranberry
fruits.health_benefits: Cranberries are well-known for their role in urinary tract health. They contain antioxidants and vitamin C to support the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Cranberries are generally safe for most people. However, excessive consumption may lead to an upset stomach or interact with certain medications.

fruits.name: Date
fruits.health_benefits: Dates are a good source of energy and contain essential minerals. They may aid in digestion and support bone health.
fruits.side_effects: Dates are high in natural sugars, so consuming them in excess may lead to weight gain or fluctuations in blood sugar levels.

fruits.name: Durian
fruits.health_benefits: Durian is rich in vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C, which supports the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Durian has a strong odor that some people find unpleasant. It is also high in calories and natural sugars, so excessive consumption may lead to weight gain or blood sugar spikes.

fruits.name: Elderberry
fruits.health_benefits: Elderberries are a rich source of antioxidants, particularly anthocyanins, which may help boost the immune system and reduce inflammation.
fruits.side_effects: Elderberries should not be consumed raw as they can cause nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea. Always cook elderberries before consuming them.

fruits.name: Fig
fruits.health_benefits: Figs are a good source of dietary fiber, promoting healthy digestion. They also contain various vitamins and minerals that support overall well-being.
fruits.side_effects: Figs are generally safe to eat, but some people may be allergic to them. Overconsumption may cause digestive issues due to their high fiber content.

fruits.name: Grapes
fruits.health_benefits: Grapes are rich in antioxidants, including resveratrol, which may benefit heart health. They also provide vitamin C for immune support.
fruits.side_effects: Grapes are generally safe to eat. However, some people may experience digestive issues or allergic reactions.

fruits.name: Guava
fruits.health_benefits: Guava is a powerhouse of vitamin C, supporting the immune system and skin health. It also contains vitamin A, which is beneficial for vision.
fruits.side_effects: Guava is safe for most people when eaten in moderation. Excessive consumption may lead to constipation due to its high fiber content.

fruits.name: Jackfruit
fruits.health_benefits: Jackfruit is rich in fiber and provides essential vitamins like vitamin C and vitamin B6, which supports metabolism and the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Jackfruit is generally safe to eat. However, some people may be allergic to it or experience digestive issues if consumed in large quantities.

fruits.name: Kiwi
fruits.health_benefits: Kiwi is packed with vitamin C, which supports the immune system and collagen production. It also provides vitamin K for blood clotting.
fruits.side_effects: Kiwi is safe for most people when eaten in moderation. Some individuals may be allergic to kiwi, leading to skin rashes or digestive problems.

fruits.name: Lychee
fruits.health_benefits: Lychee is a good source of vitamin C and antioxidants, which may help protect cells from oxidative damage and support the immune system.
fruits.side_effects: Lychee is generally safe for most people. However, consuming too many lychees may lead to the following side effects:

fruits.name: Mango
fruits.health_benefits: Mangoes are rich in vitamin C, which supports the immune system, and vitamin A, which is beneficial for vision and skin health. They are also a good source of antioxidants.
fruits.side_effects: Mangoes are safe for most people when eaten in moderation. Excessive consumption may lead to stomach upset or allergies in some individuals.

fruits.name: Orange
fruits.health_benefits: Oranges are famous for their high vitamin C content, supporting the immune system and promoting skin health. They are also rich in antioxidants.
fruits.side_effects: Oranges are safe for most people when consumed in moderation. Some individuals may experience heartburn or sensitivity to citrus fruits.

fruits.name: Pineapple
fruits.health_benefits: Pineapples are a good source of vitamin C, which supports the immune system and aids in collagen production. They also contain bromelain, an enzyme that may aid digestion.
fruits.side_effects: Pineapples can cause mouth and tongue irritation due to bromelain. Additionally, excessive consumption may lead to digestive discomfort.

fruits.name: Quince
fruits.health_benefits: Quinces are rich in vitamin C, supporting the immune system and overall health. They also contain dietary fiber, promoting digestive health.
fruits.side_effects: Quinces are generally safe to eat, but some people may be allergic to them or experience stomach upset when consumed in large quantities.

fruits.name: Raspberry
fruits.health_benefits: Raspberries are a good source of antioxidants, vitamin C, and vitamin K. They may help reduce oxidative stress and support heart health.
fruits.side_effects: Raspberries are safe for most people. However, some individuals may be allergic to them or experience digestive issues when consuming a large amount.

fruits.name: Strawberry
fruits.health_benefits: Strawberries are rich in vitamin C and antioxidants, promoting immune health and reducing inflammation. They also provide vitamin K for blood clotting.
fruits.side_effects: Strawberries are safe for most people when eaten in moderation. Some individuals may be allergic to them, leading to skin rashes or digestive problems.

fruits.name: Tomato
fruits.health_benefits: Tomatoes are a good source of vitamin C and vitamin K, which supports bone health and blood clotting. They also contain the antioxidant lycopene.
fruits.side_effects: Tomatoes are safe for most people. However, some individuals may be sensitive to them or experience acid reflux when consuming large quantities.

fruits.name: Ugli Fruit
fruits.health_benefits: Ugli fruits are rich in vitamin C, supporting the immune system and skin health. They are a hybrid of grapefruits, oranges, and tangerines.
fruits.side_effects: Ugli fruits are generally safe to eat. However, some individuals may be allergic to them or experience stomach discomfort when consuming large amounts.

fruits.name: Vanilla Bean
fruits.health_benefits: Vanilla beans contain vitamin B2, also known as riboflavin, which supports energy production and overall cell health.
fruits.side_effects: Vanilla beans are safe for most people when used in culinary applications. However, some individuals may be sensitive to vanilla and should avoid it.

fruits.name: Watermelon
fruits.health_benefits: Watermelons are hydrating and rich in vitamins, including vitamin C and vitamin A. They may help with hydration and support eye health.
fruits.side_effects: Watermelons are generally safe to eat. However, excessive consumption may lead to digestive issues or an upset stomach.
